CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 17, 1963, pg. 13 reads: "Crowning "Miss Elk" - Greater Pittsburgh Lodge, 695 Lincoln Ave., was the scene of a recent event, sponsored by Ruth Temple 116, which concluded the "Miss Elk" contest. Winners are, left to right, first row: Arlene Hardy, runner-up; Mary Ann Harper, the winner, who was crowned "Miss Elk" of 1963, and Hortense Palmer, who came in third.  Second row: T.A. Flewellen, past ruler, and other contestants: Catherine Jones, Carrie Brown, Dt. Anna E. Charles, crowning the queen; Anna B. Campbell and Hattie M. McClain, daughter ruler."
TitMainTitle: Miss Elk contestants, first row from left: Arlene Hardy, "Miss Elk" Mary Ann Harper, and Hortense Palmer; second row: T. A. Flewellen, Catherine Jones, Carrie Brown, Anna E. Charles, Anna B. Campbell, and Hattie M. McClain, posed in Greater Pittsburgh Lodge, 695 Lincoln Avenue
